articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of Ireland to DPRK
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of Ireland to DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Aingeal O'Donoghue, ambassador of Ireland to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK, Mongolia Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK, Mongolia Held
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- There took place the talks here Tuesday between Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade who doubles as chairman of the DPRK side to the Inter-governmental Committee for Consultation in Economy, Trade, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Mongolia, and Mongolian Minister of Industry and Agriculture Khaltmaa Battulga who is chairman of the Mongolian side to the Committee.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Hwang Min, vice-minister of Agriculture and chairman of the Livestock Management Committee in Sepho Area, and officials concerned, and from the Mongolian side were the Mongolian minister of Industry and Agriculture and his party, Mongolian Ambassador to the DPRK Manibadrakh Ganbold and his embassy officials.
					
					 The talks discussed boosting economic and trade cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C. C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of C. C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League Held
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The 53rd enlarged plenary meeting of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League took place here Tuesday.
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the C.C., the youth league and officials of the youth league in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks facing the organizations of the youth league to carry out the tasks set forth in supreme leader Kim Jong Un's address "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive" at the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Un's address serves as a strategic programme indicating the ever-victorious future of the Korean revolution and a banner for bringing about an epochal turn in the ideological work in the glorious Kim Jong Un's era.
					
					 They said that the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un clearly indicated the fundamental mission and duty of the youth league and wisely led it.
					
					 They referred to the big successes made in the ideological work of the youth league under the leadership and care of the peerlessly great men and set forth the tasks and ways of strengthening the ideological work.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The 76th enlarged plenary meeting of the C.C., the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) took place here Tuesday.
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the C.C., GFTUK and officials of trade unions in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks facing the trade unions to carry out the tasks set forth in supreme leader Kim Jong Un's historic address "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive" at the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Hyon Sang Ju, chairman of the C.C., GFTUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Un's address serves as a strategic programme indicating the ways of achieving the prosperity of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea and the ever-victorious future of the Korean revolution.
					
					 They referred to the big successes made in the ideological work of the trade unions under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un and underscored the need to intensify the ideological education to thoroughly embody the spirit of the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the WPK.
					
					 They called upon all organizations and officials of the trade unions to make a positive contribution to glorifying Kim Jong Un's great era as the era of glory and prosperity making progress and winning victory under the uplifted slogan "Let Us Hasten the Final Victory through a Revolutionary Ideological Offensive."

articles.title: Mexican Party Leader Expresses Invariable Support for Korean People
articles.content:
Mexican Party Leader Expresses Invariable Support for Korean People 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, national leader of the Workers' Party of Mexico, met a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by An Kun Song, DPRK ambassador to Mexico, which took part in the 18th seminar of world political parties on building new society, on March 26. 
					 The national leader said that the DPRK victoriously advanced socialist cause, holding higher the socialist banner when the Soviet Union and East European socialist countries collapsed in the early 1990s and the imperialists and reactionaries talked about the "end" of socialism. 
					
					 The national leader went on:
					
					 The DPRK has achieved great successes in economic construction and the drive for improving the people's living standard under the wise guidance of the respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, greatly encouraging the world progressive political parties and people.
					
					 Most just are the policies set forth by the WPK for peace and reunification of the country and measures taken by it for implementing them. 
					
					 The situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula clearly shows who sincerely hopes for peace and reunification and who seeks war and separation. 
					
					 The Workers' Party of Mexico fully supports all policies and measures of the WPK for peace and reunification of the country and will as ever extend invariable support and solidarity to the just cause of the Korean people.

articles.title: Day of Pakistan Marked
articles.content:
Day of Pakistan Marked
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with staff members of the Pakistani embassy here took place at DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Pyongyang June 9 Ryongbuk Senior Secondary School on Tuesday to mark the Day of Pakistan. 
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Syed Hasan Habib and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 Jong Yong Won, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Pakistan Friendship Association, and members of the association and teachers and students of the school were present there.
					
					 The participants went round various places of the school after being briefed on it at the room dedicated to the history of the school. 
					
					 They talked to one another about the need to boost the friendly relations between the two countries and enjoyed an art performance given by students, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: Universal 12-year Compulsory Education Enforced in DPRK with Beginning of New School Year
articles.content:
Universal 12-year Compulsory Education Enforced in DPRK with Beginning of New School Year
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The universal 12-year compulsory education is put into practice across the DPRK with the start of the new school year (2014-2015) on Tuesday.
					 The universal 12-year compulsory education system is guaranteed by the law adopted at the 6th session of the 12th DPRK Supreme People's Assembly in 2012. The enforcement of the system marks a milestone in fully demonstrating the dignity of the country desirous of building an educational power and a highly civilized socialist state.
					
					 New pupils and students were warmly welcomed by teachers, senior pupils and their parents at schools of different levels across the country.
					
					 Ri Kyong Hui, mother of Kim Ho Ung, a newcomer of Ryusong Primary School in Central District, Pyongyang, told KCNA:
					
					 I am very pleased that my son will receive the universal 12-year compulsory education.
					
					 The respected Marshal Kim Jong Un has always paid deep attention to bringing up the younger generation to be reliable successors to the revolution. I am deeply impressed by his noble outlook on the future and the rising generation. 
					
					 I will make my son study hard in hearty response to the noble intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 So Sung Hyok, a teacher of Kinjae Junior Secondary School in Sosong District, said:
					
					 In the period of junior secondary school, pupils can acquire basic technological knowledge. New teaching programs and methods have already been prepared in conformity with teaching guidelines.
					
					 We, teachers, will make all our efforts to bring up pupils to be talents, as intended by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Ryang Ju Ryong, a new student of Saesalrim Senior Secondary School in Tongdaewon District, said he would study hard to get good knowledge as well as good moral character and good health.
					
					 Kim Song Il, a department director of the Ministry of General Education under the Education Commission, said he would devotedly work to prepare all students to be pillars of the country, in hearty response to the WPK's education policy.

articles.title: Russian Diplomats Tour Nampho City
articles.content:
Russian Diplomats Tour Nampho City
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Timonin and his embassy officials toured Nampho City Tuesday on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the agreement on economic and cultural cooperation between the DPRK and the Russian Federation.
					 They visited the Taean Friendship Glass Factory. They looked round various production processes, being briefed on the fact that the factory has contributed to the building of an economic power.
					
					 They also visited the Nampho General Foodstuff Factory and other places.

articles.title: Mongolian Minister of Industry and Agriculture Pays Tribute to Statues
articles.content:
Mongolian Minister of Industry and Agriculture Pays Tribute to Statues
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Minister of Industry and Agriculture Khaltmaa Battulga who is chairman of the Mongolian side to the Inter-governmental Committee for Consultation in Economy, Trade, Science and Technology between the DPRK and Mongolia, and his party laid a bouquet before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Begins
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest Begins
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Prize Sports Contest began with due ceremony at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium Tuesday in the run-up to the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Its participants will compete in dozens of events including football, basketball, volleyball, weightlifting, wrestling, judo, field hockey, track and field and gymnastics in Pyongyang, Wonsan, Phyongsong, Haeju, Nampho and other cities.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier, Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, officials concerned, sports persons and citizens.
					
					 Vice Premier Kim Yong Jin made an opening address.
					
					 At the end of the opening ceremony there took place the men's volleyball game between the April 25 Team and Amnokgang Team.

articles.title: Moranbong Band's Performance Draws Many People
articles.content:
Moranbong Band's Performance Draws Many People
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Moranbong Band has given performances at the April 25 House of Culture here before full houses.
					 Tens of thousands of people, including schoolchildren and foreigners, have watched ten performances given since its start on March 23.
					
					 For 10 days of performances the band raised an unprecedented sensation in the capital city. 
					
					 The performance began with female chorus "The People's Joy". Put on the stage were such numbers as female solo and pangchang "We Think of the Marshal Day and Night", female solo "O My Motherland Full of Hope" and light music "Footsteps of a Soldier".
					
					 At the turn of each number, the audience warmly clapped, mesmerized by Songun music.
					
					 The performances evoked a lively response among audience.
					
					 After enjoying the band's performance, they described it as a "performance which kicked off ideological offensive", "songs making audience refreshed", "unique performance bringing party policies home to people" and "performance which demonstrated the might and characteristics of our music."

articles.title: Japan's Moves for Nuclear Weaponization Can Never Be Tolerated: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan's Moves for Nuclear Weaponization Can Never Be Tolerated: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the deputy director of the strategic planning bureau at Japan's Ministry of Defense said that the DPRK's mobile nuclear capability may increase the danger. He even went the lengths of asserting that Japan should strengthen its deterrent focusing on "threat from north Korea".
					 Whenever an opportunity presents itself, Japan has pulled up the DPRK over the strengthening of its military power, calling for "Japan's possession of striking ability" allegedly to cope with it. And it had already stipulated its "possession of striking ability" in "defense programme guidelines".
					
					 It is needless to say that such moves of Japan are prompted by a dangerous scheme to find an excuse for its independent nuclear weaponization, though the islands are put under the U.S. nuclear umbrella.
					
					 In the present world, any country should adduce political or military reasons proper for its access to nukes, like infringement upon its security or fundamental interests by others. But Japan has no justification for it.
					
					 Japan has long been proud of being put under the protection of nuclear umbrella provided by its master, the U.S. Therefore, Japan's hue and cry over threat from others makes no sense.
					
					 Furthermore, there is no country forcing a nuclear war on Japan in the world. In a word, Japan has neither reason nor justification for the possession of nukes.
					
					 Nevertheless, Japan has regarded its access to nukes as one of its strategic goals since its defeat in the Second World War.
					
					 The militaristic reactionaries of Japan, who ascribed its defeat in the war to its failure in possessing nuclear weapons, had made desperate efforts to make legal and material preparations for nuclear weaponization. It was clearly evidenced by the fact that former Japanese Prime Minister Sato, at a meeting with the then U.S. president in January 1965, denounced China's nuclear test and clamored for Japan's possession of nukes against China's possession of nukes.
					
					 Now Japan takes the third place in the list of atomic energy giants after acquiring all necessary nuclear facilities and the fifth place in the list of plutonium possessors. It has also many competent nuclear technicians and capabilities to launch inter-continental ballistic rocket.
					
					 Japan has already removed all legal and institutional hurdles standing in the way of possessing nuclear weapons. 
					
					 Foreign media are commenting that Japan's nuclear ability would surpass the U.S. in the near future.
					
					 Under these circumstances, it is the last step for Japan to get a justification for its possession of nukes to be accepted by the international community. To this end, Japan is making no bones to take issue with the DPRK.
					
					 It is a cunning plot of the Japanese reactionaries to justify Japan's hostile policy toward the DPRK and its nuclear weaponization under the pretext of "nuclear threat from north Korea" and thus launch nuclear preemptive attack upon it.
					
					 Japan is mistaken if it thinks that it can materialize its sinister scheme for access to nukes in the plea of deceptive "security threat".
					
					 The progressive people of the world will never pardon Japan's dangerous moves for nuclear weaponization.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ushering in Period of Prosperity of Songun Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ushering in Period of Prosperity of Songun Korea
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- It is the steadfast will of the army and people of the DPRK to usher in the period of prosperity of Songun Korea, true to the patriotic cause of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the great Workers' Party of Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were peerless patriots who dedicated everything to the building of a rich and powerful country all their lives with ardent love for the country and its people which no great man in the world could ever match.
					
					 Thanks to their energetic leadership, our country, once eclipsed in the world map, emerged a socialist power in a historically short period, demonstrating the nation's dignity and honor before the whole world century after century.
					
					 The on-going general offensive to usher in a new period of prosperity of Songun Korea is a patriotic onward movement to firmly preserve the immortal feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed on behalf of the country and its people and translate their last instructions into shining realities.
					
					 The editorial calls for eternally glorifying their patriotic feats, bearing deep in mind the awareness and mission of being descendants of Kim Il Sung and soldiers and disciples of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It also calls for upholding with loyalty the idea and leadership of Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the party, the state and the army.
					
					 It underlines the need to intensify the work to apply Kim Jong Il's patriotism in practice.
					
					 It calls for thoroughly embodying the spirit of the 8th Conference of Ideological Workers of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It also underscores the need for all service personnel and people to intensify the drive to achieve the final victory in building a thriving nation under the leadership of the great party and successfully carry forward the patriotic cause of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Park Geun Hye's Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules Park Geun Hye's Reckless Remarks
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- During her recent trip to Germany south Korean chief executive Park Geun Hye behaved so impudently as to say that she has much to "learn" from the unification of Germany and she would like to follow the "example" set by it.   Ridiculously enough, she in a "speech" referred to her "initiative on Korea's unification".
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 Park's sophism and her disgusting behavior are arousing repugnance and disillusion as there is no worth making any inquiry into reason and truth.
					
					 Park groundlessly slung mud at the DPRK, talking about its "economic difficulties". This is an unpardonable insult and mockery of the compatriots in the north.
					
					 As a matter of fact, "unification" touted by Park is nothing but "unification of social systems" against the nation's will as it is aimed  to undermine the dignified ideology and social system of the DPRK.
					
					She is so brazen-faced as to tout "unification initiative" though she has such ulterior motive. 
					
					 Her rhetoric about "support" for someone, "co-prosperity" and "restoration of homogeneity" would get her nowhere. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities have so far checked the north-south NGO exchanges of people of various circles case by case and even sidelined even the matter for increasing wages of the workers at the Kaesong Industrial Zone even a bit. However, they are now misleading the public opinion by touting "co-prosperity" and "restoration of homogeneity". They are nothing but sheer lies and  height of hypocrisy. Park's blabbering about "unification" in such embarrassing position only betrays her uneasiness and worry about crisis. 
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive persistently pursues confrontation, far from drawing a lesson from her recent junket, she will be wholly to blame for the ensuing baneful impact on the north-south relations.

articles.title: U.S. Should Return Cultural Artifacts It Looted from Korea: Minju Joson
articles.content:
U.S. Should Return Cultural Artifacts It Looted from Korea: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Public in the U.S. is becoming vocal demanding the return of cultural artifacts dating back to the Korean feudal dynasty which the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces looted during the last Korean war. Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says:
					 Posted on the White House internet website recently was an article urging President Obama to return cultural artifacts which GIs took away during the Korean war in the 1950s. It is said that a non-governmental organization in Washington D.C. also sent a similar message to the U.S. State Department.
					
					 The U.S. president's call for sending cultural artifacts back to Korea, their owner, is entirely just in the light of ethics and morality in the human world and from international legal point of view.
					
					 The Korean nation with a time-honored history and culture has many valuable cultural artifacts which it can boast in the world. But lots of them were looted or vandalized by the gangster-like U.S. imperialists.
					
					 During the Korean war in the 1950s, in particular, the U.S. imperialists indiscriminately vandalized or massively looted precious cultural artifacts of the Korean nation wherever they went.
					
					 It has now become an international trend to sincerely apologize for past wrongdoings, and for the assailants to make reparation to the victims.
					
					 The U.S. should also apologize to the Korean nation and make due reparation for its atrocities and crimes committed during the last Korean war.
					
					 It should clarify the truth about the plunder of Korea's cultural artifacts including the Royal seal belonging to the Korean feudal dynasty and make a bold decision to return all the valuable cultural treasures it looted from Korea.

articles.title: Japan's Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery Cannot Be Denied: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Crimes Related to Sexual Slavery Cannot Be Denied: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Documents of the U.S. forces proving that the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army were committed in an organized way were declassified recently.
					 One of those deals with the contents of questioning a Japanese army taken captive in Myanmar (the then Burma) in April, 1945. Recorded in it are statements of the captive who admitted the fact that the army set up and operated "comfort stations" in different parts of Myanmar.
					
					 A series of documents were opened to public again, clearly proving that the heinous unethical crimes committed by Japan in the last century are a historical fact that can never be denied, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says. It goes on:
					
					 However, Japan is working hard to evade the responsibility for the past crimes while totally denying and distorting them, far from making an apology and reparation for them.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are making much ado with claims that "there was no document about the state involvement" in the crimes related to sexual slavery, "they were voluntary acts of prostitutes to make money" and "there were comfort women in any country which fought a war."
					
					 These days, there are such signs in Japan as denying the Kono statement which admitted that the Imperial Japanese Army was involved in the sexual slavery and the recruitment, transport and management of sexual slaves were conducted by honeyed words and coercion, not by their own will, and apologized for it.
					
					 It is a height of shamelessness peculiar to Japan and a clear expression of the persistent and vicious disposition of samurais.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are doggedly denying the past crimes and justifying the crime-woven history, a revelation of their sinister ploy to attain its ambition for reinvasion at any cost by accelerating the moves to make Japan militaristic and lurch to right.
					
					  The world will record and prove all the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past and settle accounts with them.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's European Tour Brings Disgrace to Korean Nation
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's European Tour Brings Disgrace to Korean Nation
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye's foolish behavior has brought disgrace to the Korean nation as the days go by. She did the same during her European tour.
					 In Dresden, Germany, she made public a "plan for peaceful unification of the Korean Peninsula".
					
					 As far as her plan is concerned, it is little different from "proposal for unification" and "confidence-building process" much touted by her in south Korea, which have been criticized as "unilateral plan" and "policy toward the north without core issues".
					
					 Park Geun Hye, ill-famed as chatterbox, has made a string of seductive remarks, while being puffed up with self-importance. Her behavior reminds everyone of a spinster wandering to hunt for a "political husband".
					
					 But her specious words lured political swindlers and extreme conservatives only like traitors to the nation or agents of the "Intelligence Service".
					
					 To tell the truth, no one likes capricious Park as she gave up or reversed all her commitments to bettering the people's living she made during her "presidential election" campaign.
					
					 She worked out the "confidence-building process", a policy of confrontation against the country's reunification, only to excite public anger.
					
					 Under these circumstances, it is said that if she made public anything against the national interests, she would be shot to death like her father.
					
					 Probably for this reason, it seems that she went to Europe to make public the above-said "plan for unification".
					
					 But her announcement of the plan, the keynotes of which are "settlement of humanitarian issues", "building of infrastructure for common prosperity" and "restoration of homogeneity", invited strong criticism and protest of Korean residents in Germany.
					
					 Lurking behind her plan is a sinister intention for "unification by absorption", which will escalate north-south confrontation and war danger and keep national division permanently.
					
					 Even a senior German politician, who was agape at her foolish doings, advised her that she should open mind and lend an ear to north Koreans.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, bereft of national dignity, is doomed to a stern punishment of the nation.
					
					 By Jo Yong Ok, an official of the International Affairs Department of the C.C., Democratic Women's Union of Korea.

articles.title: Reckless Remarks of U.S. Ambassador to S. Korea Blasted
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of U.S. Ambassador to S. Korea Blasted 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. ambassador to south Korea blustered "human rights records in North Korea are deplorable," revealing his hostility towards the DPRK. 
					 The U.S. imperialist forces of aggression stamped out all freedom and rights of the south Korean people from the moment they landed in south Korea, turning it into a tundra of human rights. 
					
					 In September 1945, the then commander of the U.S. troops in south Korea ordered to severely punish without mercy those offering resistance and disturbing orders and security and deprived the south Korean people of all political rights and brought disasters to them. 
					
					 GIs human rights abuses have become evermore outrageous with the passage of time. 
					
					 The rate of crimes committed by them in 2009 was 64.2 percent higher than that in 2008. 
					
					 The Ministry of Justice of south Korea said that traffic accidents caused by GIs in 2011 were 165 cases but those rose to 166 in the first half of the year 2012. 
					
					 319 high profile crimes were committed by them in Kyonggi Province from 2010 to August of 2012. 
					
					 Rights of south Korean women are mercilessly trampled down by GIs wherever they go. 
					
					 They brutally kill south Korean women or force them into sexual slavery. When counting the damage done by them according to the standard to be applied for getting reparation for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, it stood at a total of more than hundreds of billions of U.S. dollars as of early in the 2000s. 
					
					 The horrible threat posed by the U.S. troops to the life and right to existence of the people in the areas under their occupation amounts to human right abuses which should no longer be overlooked. 
					
					 The oil which leaked from the U.S. forces base in Ryongsan of Seoul in 2001 has contaminated since then the land covering over 12,200 square meters. A survey of underground water around the areas said carcinogenic substance was over 1,300 times higher than the tolerance limit. 
					
					 A survey of soil in the U.S. military base in Kunsan in North Jolla Province and areas around it revealed that the soil contaminated by oil was 26 times the tolerance limit. Toxic substance exceeding over 30 times the tolerance limit was discovered in the U.S. base in Waegwan in Chilgok County, North Kyongsang Province. 
					
					 It is preposterous, indeed, for the U.S. to dare find fault with the DPRK, trumpeting about "defense of human rights" though it trained anti-human rights gangsters keen on murder, arson, destruction and plunder.

articles.title: DPRK Women Jeer at Park Geun Hye of S. Korea for Her Babble
articles.content:
DPRK Women Jeer at Park Geun Hye of S. Korea for Her Babble
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye, the chief executive of south Korea, made reckless remarks of no help to the Korean nation during her recent trip to Germany.
					 Like an uneducated woman, she said that Germany and south Korea are "alike" and she has many things to learn and wants to follow the example of Germany.
					
					 In this regard, women in the DPRK are now jeering at her turpitude.
					
					 An Kyong Hui, a Pyongyang citizen, told KCNA:
					
					 It was not long ago that being an ignoramus, Park Geun Hye made a foolish speech, written by her aides, on the DPRK's nuclear issue while visiting Netherlands, only to expose herself to public disgrace.
					
					 In Dresden of Germany this time, she mentioned her "three-point proposal toward the north" as if she was taking pains to ensure "peaceful unification", but it became a laughing-stock. Her "proposal" was rejected even in south Korea as it is too poor to meet a response from the DPRK.
					
					 As a woman, I feel sorry to see Park behaving like a babbling countrywoman rather than a "president" wherever she goes.
					
					 Kim Un Gyong, a doctor at the Moranbong District People's Hospital in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 In Germany Park talked nonsense that the DPRK suffers economic difficulty and food shortage, with a script cooked up by the Intelligence Service on the basis of defectors' vituperations.
					
					 Disgusted at such nonsense, media of south Korea blamed her aides for having offered distorted information, questioning that Park went back to the 20th century.
					
					 What she does reminds people of a childish girl or a slow-witted person who does not know to act her age.
					
					 It is ridiculous for Park to care about others' economic situation with south Korea faced with economic collapse and destitution.
					
					 She had better mind her own business, refraining from spinning gossip about others.

articles.title: Punishment of S. Korean Military Hooligans Demanded
articles.content:
Punishment of S. Korean Military Hooligans Demanded
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- People from different walks of life in the DPRK are now urging a merciless punishment of the south Korean military warmongers who recently seized a fishing boat of the DPRK and beat its crewmen into coma with iron bars.
					 Expressing his anger at the south Korean military pirates, Kim Kang Ho, a department director of the C.C., General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, told KCNA:
					
					 It is an international usage to help any peaceable ship in distress.
					
					 The south Korean military gangsters' inhuman atrocities should never be pardoned. With such gangsters left intact, it is impossible to expect improved north-south relations and the Korean nation will face a catastrophic war.
					
					 Merciless punishment should be given to those gangsters getting hell-bent on anti-DPRK moves, preoccupied by extreme hostility.
					
					 Jo Yong Suk, a section chief of the C.C., Democratic Women's Union of Korea, said:
					
					 The recent case is a product of the south Korean authorities' persistent and vicious policy of confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, the boss of the south Korean group of traitors, called for "unification era" and "humanism" outside while egging villains to commit such gangsterism at home, in a bid to make a chance for invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 She acted as if she was an "apostle of unification", but her dirty colors as a die-hard separatist was fully revealed through the case.
					
					 The pirates on Paekryong Island, a haunt of devils, are depraved guys little different from fickle Park Geun Hye, who has tempted the world people with a dagger of confrontation in her belt.
					
					 We, women in the DPRK, will never pardon the Park Geun Hye group and the puppet military gangsters engaged in crimes against humanity.

articles.title: Cooking Festival Held
articles.content:
Cooking Festival Held 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang City Cooking Festival took place at the Ponghwasan Hotel with the approach of the Day of the Sun (April 15), the birthday of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The festival was attended by cooks from district-level restaurants under the Public Catering Management Bureau of the Pyongyang City People's Committee and the Ponghwasan Hotel.
					
					 What caught visitors' eyes at the festival were roasted eel mixed with fermented soybean, roasted turkey, mullet jelly and steamed mushroom.
					
					 Pak Song Chol, chief engineer of the bureau, told KCNA that it was hard to gauge the rankings because the attendants' cooking skills have reached a high level.
					
					 Ra Kyong Ok, manager of the Kangdong County Restaurants Management Office, said that she has learned a lot through the festival.
					
					 "I think officials should, first of all, have a deep knowledge of cuisines in order to develop cooking," she said, adding that restaurant under her office would top the rankings from next year.
					
					 Top team prizes were awarded to the Taedonggang District Restaurants Management Office and Ponghwasan Hotel, team prizes to the Central District Restaurants Management Office and the Taesong District Restaurants Management Office and diplomas and technical prizes to different cooks who proved successful.

articles.title: Mad-cap Ssangyong Drill Goes On in S. Korea
articles.content:
Mad-cap Ssangyong Drill Goes On in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggression forces and their followers are staging Ssangyong landing operational drill in real earnest as part of the largest-ever Foal Eagle joint military exercises, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News on March 31.
					 Involved in the drill that started on March 27 are more than 7,500 marines of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces, over 2,000 south Korean puppet marines and over 130 Australian soldiers, over 12,500 in all.
					
					  On March 31 the warmongers staged a naval drill under the simulated conditions of mounting an attack on a coast of the north with naval and air forces including landing craft, destroyers, escort ships and logistic support ships with various missions as well as transport planes and helicopter gunships involved in the area of Phohang, North Kyongsang Province.
					
					 The forces involved in the drill are several times bigger than the previous ones. It is expected to last till April 7 with an additional program for air attack on the north added to it.
					
					 The warmongers bluffed that the on-going military exercise is the second biggest in scale after the Team Spirit joint military exercises and opened the drill to public. 
					
					 They describe the drill as "defensive and annual" though aggression and war means move to places simulating areas in the DPRK, firing bullets and shells. Their lame excuses will convince no one. These madcap war exercises self-expose that the U.S. imperialists and the puppet military group are the harassers of peace and provocateurs of war.

articles.title: Landing Drill Targeting DPRK Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Landing Drill Targeting DPRK Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Members of the People's Action for Peace against War of south Korea staged a protest in the area of Phohang, North Kyongsang Province on March 31 denouncing the Ssangyong drill for aggression being staged by the U.S. imperialists and their allies, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 The protesters branded the large-scale landing drill as an offensive drill for occupying key strongholds of the rival side, not a "defensive drill" for repelling other's attack.
					
					 It is a matter of great concern that the military hostile acts are conducted at a time when the south and the north should open a chapter for dialogue and hold negotiations for building peace-keeping mechanism, they deplored, urging the warmongers to immediately stop the military exercises.

articles.title: News Analyst on Vulgar Diplomacy of S. Korean Ruler
articles.content:
News Analyst on Vulgar Diplomacy of S. Korean Ruler
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye, the host of Chongwadae, has disgraced the Korean nation, touring other countries after coming to power in south Korea.
					 During her recent trip to Germany, she viciously maligned the DPRK, with her mouth that had called for "halt to slandering among the fellow countrymen". 
					
					 Shunning to the rapidly-changing reality of the DPRK, Park talked jargon on the basis of a scenario worked out by the "Intelligence Service" with the defectors' vituperations that the DPRK suffers "economic difficulty" and "food shortage". And she talked about "restoration of homogeneity", provoking a side-splitting laughter.
					
					 She also put forth a "unification proposal" woven with junk only to arouse ridicules and criticism even from among her hirelings.
					
					 Park seems to have neither an elementary political philosophy nor idea, and no sign as befitting a member of the Korean nation is seen in her.
					
					 It would be better to call her a "lowbrow politician" as she acts like a meddlesome countrywoman, not knowing where she stands.
					
					 She had already behaved in a shameful manner during her foreign tours to stun all her fellow countrymen.
					
					 In Netherlands, she parroted a foolish speech written by her ignorant aides over the DPRK's nuclear issue to bring disgrace to herself under the eyes of the world.
					
					 When she arrived at an airport in New York, there was no American official to greet her. But she, instead of feeling affronted and expressing anger, spoke in broken English at a Congress meeting to become a butt for ridicule. Her clumsy behaviors were witnessed in Britain and France, too.
					
					 So, people from all walks of life in south Korea criticized such disgusting behaviors as "acme of the nation's dishonor" and an "act of losing her position as a sovereign".
					
					 There is some reason in the fact that Japan's newsweekly Shukanbunshun ridiculed what Park did as diplomacy of an auntie who would break out in invectives.

articles.title: Farce Lauding "Yusin" Dictator Opposed
articles.content:
Farce Lauding "Yusin" Dictator Opposed
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Self-governing Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society in Tangjin, south Korea in a statement on March 30 denounced the farce lauding "yusin" dictator, according to the south Korean internet paper Voice of People.
					 The statement said that a so-called memorial society is going to erect the bust of Park Chung-hee in Tangjin, South Chungchong Province.
					
					 The statement demanded an immediate stop to the move, calling it a shameful act of mocking at the people.

articles.title: S. Korean Scholar Blasts Park Geun Hye's Anti-Reunification Speech in Germany
articles.content:
S. Korean Scholar Blasts Park Geun Hye's Anti-Reunification Speech in Germany
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- An article written by scholar Ko Sung U was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on March 30. The article denounced anti-reunification remarks made by the south Korean chief executive.
					 Referring to the "three-point proposal for laying a foundation for peaceful unification" made by Park Geun Hye during her trip to Germany, the article said:
					
					 The three-point proposal, namely "settlement of humanitarian issues", "laying of a foundation for improving the people's livelihood" and the "restoration of homogeneity of the people in the south and the north", is nothing but empty words and something disappointing.
					
					 She did not utter even a word about the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises now under way in south Korea, escalating military tensions on the Korean peninsula and throwing the people into fear.
					
					 She chose Germany as a place to make the speech which had no special contents to speak of. This arouses skepticism as to whether she had not presupposed "unification through absorption" of the north.
					
					 The Park Geun Hye regime is pursuing the policy of pressurizing and blockading the north together with the U.S. and openly staging military exercises to cope with "contingency" in the DPRK, while shunning the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration just as the Lee Myung Bak regime did, only to be rebuffed by the north.
					
					  After taking office, Park persistently insisted on "May 24 step" and did not come out for improving the south-north relations, asserting that the south-north exchanges and cooperation can be possible only when the "north's nuclear issue" is settled. 
					
					 This shows that Park's recent proposal only stokes distrust between the south and the north.
					
					 The article stressed that the blueprint for reunification is already clarified in the July 4 joint statement and the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Japanese Authorities Accused of Trying to IIIegally Sell Korean Hall of Chongryon
articles.content:
Japanese Authorities Accused of Trying to IIIegally Sell Korean Hall of Chongryon
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. made public a statement titled "We Denounce the Japanese Authorities for Their Racket to Illegally Sell the Korean Hall of Chongryon" on March 29.
					 The statement accused the Japanese authorities of letting the Tokyo District Court make an illegal decision to allow the sale of the Korean Hall of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) on March 24.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 This is a sinister plot hatched by the Japanese government in collusion with the court and the Resolution and Collection Corporation for several years as part of their suppression aimed at stifling Chongryon.
					
					 It is a shameless political operation for the Japanese authorities to undermine Chongryon active for the peaceful reunification and prosperity of the country and the rights and interests of the Koreans living in Japan with pride and honor of being an organization of  members of the Korean nation.
					
					 The above-said illegal decision is a token of suppression of Koreans in Japan and, at the same time, an act of showing enmity toward all Koreans in the north, south and abroad.
					
					 The Japanese government should rescind the mean and disgraceful decision.
					
					 The Japanese government will be held accountable for recklessly suppressing Koreans, oblivious of its ill-fame as a war criminal state.
					
					 It is natural for the Japanese government to honestly apologize to Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and give assurances against the recurrence of the above-said case.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Works Carried by Bulgarian Organization in Its Bulletin
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Works Carried by Bulgarian Organization in Its Bulletin
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The gists of President Kim Il Sung's works "A Talk to a Delegation from the Soviet News Agency Tass" and "A Talk to the Chairman of the Social Democratic Party of Denmark" were carried by the Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association on its special bulletin on Mar. 21.
					 Those works, published on March 31 and May 5, Juche 73 (1984), explain in detail the sustained efforts of the DPRK to reunify the country independently and peacefully on the principle of democracy and bring to light the moves of the U.S. imperialists and south Korean authorities to hinder the efforts.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Is Lodestar of Korea's Reunification: Swiss Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Is Lodestar of Korea's Reunification: Swiss Organization
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- A special write-up was posted by the Swiss preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung on the websites of the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on Mar. 16, accompanied with a photo of the President.
					 An article titled "President Kim Il Sung, lodestar of Korea's reunification" said:
					
					 The President had singled out Korea's reunification as the supreme task of the nation from the moment of Korea's division and worked heart and soul to reunify the country till the last moments of his life.
					
					 He convened the historic Joint Conference of Representatives of Political Parties and Social Organizations in North and South Korea in Pyongyang in April, 1948.
					
					 Fascinated by the great intention, ardent patriotism and noble virtues of the President, a south Korean figure could come out to the struggle for national reunification after reflecting on his whole life against communism.
					
					 The President advanced many proposals for national reunification and set forth basic principles and ways for it.
					
					 He received lots of compatriots from south Korea and overseas fighting for the independent reunification of Korea.
					
					 When a flood hit south Korea, he made sure that a large amount of relief goods were sent to the flood victims.
					
					 He showed great loving care for south Koreans.
					
					 Therefore, all the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad held him in high esteem as the lodestar of national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Guinean Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Guinean Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung and the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint special bulletin "On the occasion of the 102nd birth anniversary of the great leader President Kim Il Sung" on Mar. 19.
					 The bulletin said in an article titled "Eternal sun of Juche":
					
					 The President, the founder of socialist Korea, is being praised as the eternal sun of Juche by progressive mankind.
					
					 He fathered the immortal Juche idea to provide the great guiding idea for accomplishing the human cause of independence. 
					
					 The Juche idea deeply rooted in the hearts of the progressive people all over the world is recognized as the guiding idea representing the era.
					
					 The struggle of the popular masses to build a new independent world free from domination, subordination, interference and pressure, under the banner of the Juche idea is sure to win.
					
					 The tender-hearted image of the President, who pioneered the era of independence and devoted his whole life to the victorious advance of the human cause of independence, will always be cherished in the hearts of the world people aspiring after independence as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 An article titled "Great father of people" said the President was not only the leader of one country but the benevolent father taking care of the life and destiny of the people. It introduced in detail the noble virtues of the President, who devoted his all to the work to bring about the happiness of the people.

articles.title: Tax-free DPRK Praised by British Organizations
articles.content:
Tax-free DPRK Praised by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a joint statement on Mar. 18 40 years since the tax system was abolished in the DPRK. 
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK became the first tax-free country in the world as the law "On abolishing the tax system" was promulgated at the 3rd Session of the Fifth Supreme People's Assembly on March 21, 1974.
					
					 It was an eye-opening event.
					
					 The Korean people got rid of all taxes and lead a happy life under the social benefits such as free education and medical care systems.
					
					 The rising generation of the DPRK doesn't know what tax is like.
					
					 Tax in the capitalist countries is a serious social problem.
					
					 The people's life has improved after the tax system was totally abolished in the DPRK.
					
					 This was, indeed, a miracle of history.
					
					 The DPRK turned into the genuine people's paradise thanks to the politics for loving the people pursued by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The material and cultural life of the Korean people is steadily improving under the wise leadership of the respected HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Statement of NDC of DPRK Supported by Nepali Political Parties, Organizations
articles.content:
Statement of NDC of DPRK Supported by Nepali Political Parties, Organizations
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Twenty-one political parties and organizations of Nepal including the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) issued a joint statement on Mar. 19 in support of the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. is ever screwing up military tensions on the Korean peninsula despite the DPRK's repeated warnings and strong protest of the world public and this is increasing the danger of a war day by day.
					
					 The DPRK has the legitimate right to protect its sovereignty, dignity and independent development.
					
					 The U.S. sanctions and moves to stifle the DPRK are lashing the Korean people into a great fury.
					
					 We demand the U.S. stop at once the dangerous act of bringing down the socialist system in the DPRK through "human rights" racket and think in a realistic manner.
					
					 The Korean people duly have the right to choose their own social system and develop it.
					
					 To roll back the hostile policy towards the DPRK as soon as possible, discontinue all joint military exercises for aggression on the Korean peninsula and settle all issues through talks with the DPRK will be a wise behavior and beneficial thing for the U.S.

articles.title: Romanian Party Denounces U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
Romanian Party Denounces U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Romania made public a statement on March 24 in denunciation of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. is persistently pursuing the vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK to bring down the socialist system in the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. regards the "human rights issue" as a means for interfering in internal affairs of progressive and independent countries. 
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. may try to tarnish the image of the DPRK, socialist Korea centered on the popular masses will advance invariably and dynamically. 
					
					 The U.S. had better ponder what to do, clearly realizing that its decades-long hostile policy toward the DPRK is bound to finally go into bankruptcy. 
					
					 The Socialist Party of Romania bitterly denounces the U.S. imperialist hostile policy toward the DPRK and strongly demands the U.S. stop the military drills for aggression and withdraw all its troops from the Korean peninsula and its vicinity. 
					
					 We will always stand by the just Korean people.

articles.title: U.S. Pressure Will Never Work on DPRK: Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Pressure Will Never Work on DPRK: Organizations 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Beninese and Bulgarian organizations released statements denouncing the U.S. anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK on March 24.
					 The Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader" and the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea said the U.S. pressure can never work on the Korean people who regard independence as their life and soul.
					
					 The statement continued:
					
					 The DPRK was compelled to have access to a nuclear deterrence for self-defense to protect the sovereignty of the country and the nation. It is natural that the Korean people opt to continue to bolster it in the face of the constant nuclear threat from the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. should immediately stop its unjustifiable "human rights" racket against the DPRK.
					
					 It is now trying to hurt the dignity of the DPRK with the "human rights" racket but Korean-style socialism centered on the masses will make steady victorious progress.
					
					 We send full support and solidarity to the Korean people now all out in the sacred struggle to defend the sovereignty of the country and the nation.
					
					 The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association said as follows:
					
					 We are deeply concerned about the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 We extend full support and encouragement to the Korean people in their struggle against the U.S. aggression policy aimed at straining the situation on the Korean peninsula and violating the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 We also strongly denounce the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Statement of NDC of DPRK Favored by Tajik Party Leader
articles.content:
Statement of NDC of DPRK Favored by Tajik Party Leader
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, made public a statement on March 20 in support of the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 The U.S. is persistently pursuing its hostile policy toward the DPRK and rendering the situation on the Korean peninsula strained with the ambition for bringing down the socialist system in the DPRK, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. is malignantly slandering the DPRK while labeling the DPRK's regular rocket launching as "provocation", though it is staging the madcap large-scale joint military exercises against the DPRK in collusion with south Korea. 
					
					 Recently the U.S. is vociferating about the "human rights issue" of the DPRK. This is nothing but sophism quite contrary to the reality. 
					
					 All the facts show that it is none other than the U.S. which is escalating tensions on the Korean peninsula and that its hostile policy toward the DPRK has already gone bankrupt. 
					
					 We fully support the statement of the NDC of the DPRK and demand the U.S. immediately drop its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. Should Respect DPRK: Organizations
articles.content:
U.S. Should Respect DPRK: Organizations 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Ugandan and Austrian organizations expressed support for the statement of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK. 
					 The Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement in a statement on March 19 said the U.S. should make a bold decision to drop its hostile policy toward the DPRK if it is sincerely concerned about peaceful development and welfare of the Korean people. 
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 The U.S. persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK is becoming the main factor of not only refraining the DPRK from making its political and economic development but also disturbing peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 We bitterly denounce the U.S. "human rights" racket, part of its hostile policy toward the DPRK, and demand the U.S. change the policy for aggression to bring down by force the social systems of sovereign countries. 
					
					 The U.S. should contribute to world peace by respecting the DPRK. 
					
					 The Solidarity Committee of Unionists for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in Austria sent a letter of protest to the U.S. embassy in Vienna on March 21. The letter strongly demanded the U.S. government drastically roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 Though it has not yet settled its human rights problem, the U.S. is kicking off the "human rights" racket against the DPRK for no reason, the letter charged. It urged the U.S. government to have sincere dialogue with the DPRK.

articles.title: Russian Politician Vows to Contribute to Boosting Russia-DPRK Friendly Relations
articles.content:
Russian Politician Vows to Contribute to Boosting Russia-DPRK Friendly Relations 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Kazbek Taysaev, secretary of Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and vice-chairman of the Economic Policy Committee of the State Duma of Russia, expressed his impressions after visiting the DPRK:
					 We witnessed in the DPRK all people full of happiness, developed culture and excellent edifices. 
					
					 Wherever we visited we could feel hospitality accorded by Korean people and their warm and sincere sentiments. 
					
					 Today the DPRK is dashing like the wind for the bright future, united close around the leader. 
					
					 The respected Comrade Kim Jong Un leading the DPRK is an outstanding leader. 
					
					 Referring to the friendly relations between the two countries, Kazbek Taysaev went on:
					
					 The long-standing friendly relations between the two countries were provided by Comrades Stalin and Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 These relations have been developed for decades. 
					
					 During our visit the Pyongyang Photo Exhibition "History of Friendship" took place to mark the 65th anniversary of the great leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's first historic official visit to the Soviet Union and the 30th anniversary of his official visit to it in 1984, thanks to joint efforts with the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 The photo exhibitions in Pyongyang, Moscow and other places are an expression of the comradely relations and firm solidarity between the two parties. 
					
					 We will make contributions to boosting the Russia-DPRK friendly relations. 
					
					 I wish the Korean people bigger successes in the future.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye's Foreign Junket Rapped by Overseas Koreans in Europe
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye's Foreign Junket Rapped by Overseas Koreans in Europe 
 Pyongyang, April 1 (KCNA) -- Park Geun Hye,  south Korean chief executive, suffered disgrace in the eyes of the world as her foreign trip was strongly protested  by Koreans in Germany.
					 The Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany, European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, One-Korean Nation European Solidarity and other overseas Koreans' organizations in Europe held a meeting in Berlin on Mar. 26 in protest against Park's European junket.
					
					 At the meeting there was a show of beating Park Geun Hye for having pursued wrong politics since her coming to power.
					
					 The speakers at the meeting accused Park, daughter of an erstwhile dictator, of being unaware of the importance of democracy and human rights and violating the south Korean workers' rights, shutting her eyes to the death of members of the Ssangyong Motors trade union.
					
					 She at the 3rd "nuclear security summit" made such reckless remarks without any scientific ground that the north's nukes pose the biggest threat, betraying her ignorance and becoming a laughing stock of the world.
					
					 German people of all social strata present at the meeting made solidarity speeches.
					
					 They brought to light the nature of the policy of privatizing the public sector in south Korea and the suppression of rights of south Korean workers opposed to it and demanded the south Korean authorities set free the workers detained for their actions for the right to existence at an early date. 
					
					 At the end of the protest they staged a demonstration, holding placards.
					
					 When the motorcade carrying Park who was on German tour was passing by, the demonstrators chanted "Park Geun Hye, Step Down!" in protest against her trip. 
					
					 The websites of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany, internet paper Minjok Thongsin for Koreans in the U.S., south Korean internet paper Voice of Seoul and other media introduced the overseas Koreans' protest actions, noting that she was drubbed.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajadora de Irlanda
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajadora de Irlanda
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- Aingeal O'Donoghue presento este martes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nueva embajadora extraordinaria y plenipotenciaria de la Republica de Irlanda en Corea. 
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con la embajadora.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre ministros de RPDC y Mongolia
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre ministros de RPDC y Mongolia 
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar este martes en esta capital las conversaciones entre el ministro de Comercio Exterior y presidente de la parte coreana del Comite Consultivo Intergubernamental de Economia, Comercio, Ciencia y Tecnica RPDC-Mongolia, Ri Ryong Nam, y el ministro de Industria y Agricultura y presidente de la parte mongolesa del comite mencionado, Khaltmaa Battulga. 
					Estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro de Agricultura y presidente del comite de administracion ganadera de la zona de Sepho, Hwang Min y otros funcionarios, y por la mongolesa, la comitiva de Khaltmaa Battulga, el embajador Manibadrakh Ganbold y miembros de esta sede diplomatica en Corea. 
					
					En la ocasion fueron discutidos los temas sobre el mayor desarrollo de la cooperacion economica y comercial entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada de Pakistan
articles.content:
Encuentro de amistad con miembros de embajada de Pakistan
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- Con motivo del dia de Pakistan, tuvo lugar este martes en la Escuela Secundaria Superior 9 de Junio de Ryongbuk de Amistad Corea-Pakistan en el capitalino municipio de Taesong el encuentro de amistad con los miembros de la Embajada de la Republica Islamica de Pakistan en Corea. 
					Fueron invitados el embajador Syed Hasan Habib y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica pakistani en Corea. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes el vicepresidente del Comite Central de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Pakistan, Jong Yong Won y otros miembros de la misma asociacion, asi como los maestros y alumnos de la escuela mencionada. 
					
					Los participantes pasaron revista a varios lugares de la escuela tras escuchar el historial de esta. 
					
					Departieron sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y estrecharon el sentimiento de amistad viendo la funcion artistica de los alumnos.

articles.title: Dirigente nacional de PTM expresa apoyo a causa de pueblo coreano
articles.content:
Dirigente nacional de PTM expresa apoyo a causa de pueblo coreano
Pyongyang, 1 de abril (ACNC) -- Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, dirigente nacional del Partido del Trabajo de Mexico se reunio con la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea encabezada por An Kun Song, embajador coreano en Mexico que participo en el XVIII seminario de los partidos politicos del mundo sobre la construccion de nueva sociedad.
					  En la ocasion el dirigente nacional dijo que cuando se derrumbaron a principios de la decada de 1990 la Union Sovietica y otros paises socialistas de la Europa Oriental y los imperialistas y otros reaccionarios abogaban ruidosamente por el "fin" del socialismo, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea llevo adelante victoriosamente la causa socialista  enarbolando la bandera del socialismo.
					
					  Destaco que hoy en dia bajo la sabia direccion del Mariscal Kim Jong Un, en la RPDC se logran muchos exitos en la construccion economica y la mejora de vida del pueblo, lo cual infunde gran confianza y coraje a los partidos politicos progresistas y pueblos del mundo.
					
					  Prosiguio que son muy justas las politicas presentadas por el PTC para lograr la paz y la reunificacion del pais y las medidas para materializarlas.
					
					  Apunto que hoy la situacion creada en la Peninsula Coreana demuestra claramente quien desea de veras la paz y la reunificacion y quien persigue la guerra y la division.
					
					  Concluyo que el PTM apoya absolutamente todas las politicas y las medidas del PTC para la paz y la reunificacion del pais y enviara en el futuro tambien el apoyo invariable y la solidaridad a la justa causa del pueblo coreano.
